abstract: Iran has deployed advanced rockets and missiles to Iraq to aid in battle against Islamic State in city of Tikrit; while none of weapons have been used, deployment, which was detected by United States intelligence officials, is significant escalation of firepower and sign of Iran's growing influence in Iraq; US officials fear arms will escalate tensions in country and lead to greater civilian casualties.
lead_paragraph: American officials fear the rockets and missiles could further inflame sectarian tensions and cause civilian casualties because they are not precision-guided.

headline.main: Iran Sent Arms to Iraq to Fight ISIS, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Iran Sent Arms to Iraq to Fight ISIS, U.S. Says

snippet: American officials fear the rockets and missiles could further inflame sectarian tensions and cause civilian casualties because they are not precision-guided.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
